meanings.definition: To furrow one's brow in an expression of displeasure or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: She would frown when she didn't like something.
meanings.sent2: Don't frown too much; it might make others feel sad.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to frown at the sight of the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed to frown upon the land below.
meanings.sent5: His frown was so deep, it seemed to carve lines on his face.

meanings.definition: A facial expression indicating unhappiness or disapproval.
meanings.sent1: Her frown showed she was not happy with the decision.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's frown made the students quiet down.
meanings.sent3: The frown on the emoji made it look grumpy.
meanings.sent4: The frown on her face was like a storm cloud over the room.
meanings.sent5: His deep frown made everyone wonder what was wrong.
